007package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
008
009import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
010import imagingbook.common.edges.CannyEdgeDetector;
011import imagingbook.common.edges.CannyEdgeDetector.Parameters;
012import imagingbook.common.image.IntegralImage;
013
014/**
015 * Used to calculate the gradient magnitude inside a given rectangular region.
016 *
017 * @author W. Burger
018 */
019public class Gradient {
020        // TODO: make more efficient
021        static IntegralImage makeGradientIntegral(int[][] I, double sigma) {
022                
023                Parameters params = new Parameters();
024                params.gSigma = sigma;
025                params.normGradMag = false;
026
027                CannyEdgeDetector detector = new CannyEdgeDetector(new FloatProcessor(I), params);
028                FloatProcessor Em = detector.getEdgeMagnitude();
029                
030//              Em.resetMinAndMax();
031//              new ImagePlus("Em", Em).show();
032                
033                int w = Em.getWidth();
034                int h = Em.getHeight();
035                
036                int[][] emi = new int[w][h];
037                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
038                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
039                                emi[u][v] = (int) Em.getf(u, v);
040                        }
041                }
042                return new IntegralImage(emi);
043        }
044        
045}
